title: (1 + x + x^2)^10
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the coefficient of x^7 in (1 + x + x^2)^10,"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We want the coefficient of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" (1 + x + x^2)^{10} \; = \; \left(\frac{1-x^3}{1-x}\right)^{10} \; = \; (1 - x)^{-10} \big(1 - 10x^3 + 45x^6 + \cdots\big) \; =\; \left(\sum_{n=0}^\infty \binom{n+9}{9} x^n\right)\big(1 - 10x^3 + 45x^6 + \cdots ) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
namely
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \binom{16}{9} - 10\times\binom{13}{9} + 45\times\binom{10}{9} \; = \; \boxed{4740} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            . We must look of the combination  of the coefficient of  x^7 from  (1)^i . (x)^j . (x^2)^k . where integers, i+j+k = 10
    So we have  (1)^3 . (x)^7 . (x^2)^0 . there are 10C3 .7C7 . 0C0, and 
            (1)^4 . (x)^5 . (x^2)^1 . there are 10C4 6C5 . 1C1, and
            (1)^5 . (x)^3 . (x^2)^2 . there are 10C5 5C3 . 2C2, and
            (1)^6 . (x)^1 . (x^2)^3 . there are 10C6 4C1 . 3C3,     total :  10C3 .7C7 . 0C0 + 10C4 6C5 . 1C1 + 10C5 5C3 . 2C2 + 10C6 4C1 . 3C3 = 4740

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":". We must look of the combination  of the coefficient of  x^7 from  (1)^i . (x)^j . (x^2)^k . where i+j+k = 10
    So we have  (1)^3 . (x)^7 . (x^2)^0 . there are 10C3 .7C7 . 0C0, and 
            (1)^4 . (x)^5 . (x^2)^1 . there are 10C4 6C5 . 1C1, and 
            (1)^5 . (x)^3 . (x^2)^2 . there are 10C5 5C3 . 2C2,and 
            (1)^6 . (x)^1 . (x^2)^3 . there are 10C6 4C1 . 3C3,     total :  10C3 .7C7 . 0C0 + 10C4 6C5 . 1C1 + 10C5 5C3 . 2C2+10C6 4C1 . 3C3 = 4740"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is an expansion of a trinomial "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum _{p=0}^3 \frac{10!}{(6-p)! (2 p+1)! (3-p)!} \Rightarrow 4740"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\sum _{p=0}^3 \left(\left(\frac{10}{6-p,\,2 p+1,\,3-p}\right)\right) \Rightarrow 4740"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The terms in the denominator, from left to right, respectively are the powers of the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" terms. Note that the combined powers of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is 7."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 1 Year on Brilliant!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Tangent is drawn at any point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(p,q)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on the parabola "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^2=4ax"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Tangents are drawn from any point on this tangent to the circle "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x^2+y^2=a^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", such that the chords of contact pass through a fixed point "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(r,s)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"p,q,r,s"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" hold which of the given relations?"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know tangent to a conic is given by T=0 , "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"i.e. Tangent to parabola at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(p,q)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2ax -yq=-2ap"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Substitute x and y in this equation by   "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x_1 , y_1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":","}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Where  "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x_1 , y_1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are points where tangent "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2ax_1 -y_1 q=-2ap"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Call this as equation "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now equation of chord of contact of circle is T=0,passing through "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(r,s)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and   "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x_1 , y_1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"rx_1 + sy_1=a^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".       ………"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are identical (in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x_1 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y_1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r/2a=-s/q=-a/2p"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now let each of these ratios be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\xi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=-2p \xi "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"r= 2a \xi = -4p( \xi)^{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"s=-q \xi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Eliminating "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \xi"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" we get "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\boxed{rq^{2}=-4ps^{2}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Must be a level 3 or 4 problem"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"image","attrs":{"src":"/brilliantexport/brioche/uploads/2n6xccQ80W-raindrops_sizessvg.png?width=1200"}},{"type":"text","text":"
As we know that a fluid always tends to minimize it's surface area due to SURFACE TENSION."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, for a given volume the sphere has the least surface area(You can prove this by concept of maxima/minima. I can provide the proof if you'll want), therefore raindrops acquire spherical shape."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"NOTE: The real shape of raindrops are an approximate OVAL due to the effect of gravity. But for very small droplets force of gravity is negligibly small & we can consider their shape as being spherical ideally."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"the answer is zero:
x$y
if x and y are even then $ is mod.
if x is odd and y is even then $ is minus.
if x is even and y is odd then $ is plus."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefor 6$2 equals 0.
The relationship could be conditional. This is normal in math"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If from each of the three boxes containing 3 white and 1 black, 2 white and 2 black, 1 white and 3 black balls, one ball is drawn at random, then the probability that 2 white and 1 black ball will be drawn is given by "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \\frac{a}{b} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" where "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" b "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  are relatively prime. then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a + b "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  is given by    "}]}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"one way is by realizing that the above sequence is only a sum of 201's a hundred times,which is equal to:
201*100
=20100"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" A=1+2+3+\ldots+199+200 "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \Rightarrow 2A= 201+201+201+\ldots+201=\frac{201\times200}{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \Rightarrow A= 201\times 100=\boxed{20100} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Sum of n no.s =n(n+1)/2
So... 200(200+1)/2=100(201)=20100"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n(n+1)/2."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Standard result for sigma(n)."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

title: 200000 points acheivement
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider a monic polynomial, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", of degree 5.\nThe graphs of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"|f(x)| "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(|x|)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are the same. \nIf 4 is a root of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then find "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The function must be odd, so that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(0) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(|x|) = |f(x)|"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" then "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) > 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all positive "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We are told that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(4) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" does not become negative in the neighborhood of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x = 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", this must be a root of even multiplicity. Because of symmetry, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is also a root of even multiplicity."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now we know at least five roots: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-4, -4, 0, 4, 4"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". There cannot be any other. Thus
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = a(x+4)^2\:x\:(x-4)^2."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Since the polynomial is monic, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Finally
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(1) = (1+4)^2\cdot 1\cdot (1-4)^2 = 25\cdot 1\cdot 9 = \boxed{225}."}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Kushal Bose – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" Yes, -4 is also a root with even multiplicity, precisely because the function is odd. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            But there may be  another two roots say a & -a.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            It is not positive everywhere. It is only positive for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x > 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", and negative for "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x < 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            I now see why my solution is confusing: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(4) = 0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a root of even multiplicity because "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" does not become negative "},{"type":"text","text":"in the neighborhood of x = 4.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" My apologies for not stating that clearly.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 2000 9s
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\underbrace{999\\dots999^3}_{\\text{Number of 9s }= \\ 2000 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"\nFind the sum of the digits of the number above."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I observed a pattern. Let "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S(n) "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" denotes the sum of the digit of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} & S(9^3) = S(729) & = 18 \\ & S(99^3) = S(970,299) & = 36 \\ & S(999^3) = S(997,002,999) & = 54 \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We can conclude that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" S\left( \underbrace{999...999^3}_{\small\text{number of 9s} = n }\right) = 18n "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"For "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" n = 2000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the answer is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" 18 \times 2000 = 36000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Proof","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This is the generalozation of "},{"type":"text","text":"Chew-Seong Cheong's","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"text","text":"Áron Bán-Szabó's","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" solution."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the expression below."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} \underbrace{99...99^3}_{\text{number of 9s} = n} & = (10^n - 1)^3 \\ & =  10^{3n} - 3 \cdot 10^{2n} + 3 \cdot 10^n - 1\\ & = \underbrace{100..00}_{\small \text{number of 0s} = 3n} - \underbrace{300...00}_{\small \text{number of 0s} = 2n} + \underbrace{300...00}_{\small \text{number of 0s} = n} - 1 \\ & = \overline{ \underbrace{99...99}_{\small n-1 \space \text{times}} 7 \underbrace{00...00}_{\small 2n \space \text{times}} } + \overline{ 2\underbrace{99...99}_{\small n \space \text{times}}} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Then,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{aligned} S\left(\underbrace{99...99^3}_{ \small \text{number of 9s} = n} \right) & = 9( n - 1 ) + 7 + 2 + 9n \\
 & = 9( n -1 ) + 9 + 9n \\ & = 9(n-1 + 1 + n) \\ & = 9(2n) = 18n \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, proved."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"

                                            "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Fidel Simanjuntak"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/fidel-451ejm/"}]},{"type":"text","text":" nice observation there! :) To complete the solution you need to prove that such pattern works for all positive integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"n"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (perhaps by induction).

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Similar solution with "},{"type":"text","text":"Áron Bán-Szabó","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":"'s"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned} N & = \underbrace{999...999^3}_{\text{Number of 9s }= \ 2000} \\ & = \left(10^{2000}-1\right)^3 \\ & = \color{#3D99F6} 10^{6000} - 3\cdot 10^{4000} + \color{#D61F06} 3\cdot 10^{2000} - 1 \\ & = \color{#3D99F6}\underbrace{999...999}_{1999}7\underbrace{000...000}_{4000} + \color{#D61F06} 2\underbrace{999...999}_{2000} \\ & = \underbrace{999...999}_{1999}7\underbrace{000...000}_{1999} 2 \underbrace{999...999}_{2000} \end{aligned} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, the sum of digits of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"N"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S_n = 9 \cdot 2999 + 7 + 2 = \boxed{36000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\underbrace{999\dots99}_{2000\space\text{number of}\space9}=10^{2000}-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\Rightarrow (10^{2000}-1)^3=10^{6000}-3*10^{4000}+3*10^{2000}-1"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
The "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(3*10^{2000}-1)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" number's first digit is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the others are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". From the back the first "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4000"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(10^{6000}-3*10^{4000})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4001."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit from the bag is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"7"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", then from the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"4002."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit to the "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"6000."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" digit all of the digits are "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"s. So the answer is:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2000*9+2+7+1999*9=\boxed{36000}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
